page.title: 12Delbury Farm
page.content: On 22nd May 1985 we went to visit Delbury Farm, a typical Corvedale farm. Delbury is the old name for Diddlebury. Mr. Morgan has been at the farm for 38 years. The farm, 190 acres, is medium loam and is{mixed. }100 acres is used for {corn,}40 acres wheat, 8 acres oats and 52 acres barley. They hire a combine harvester. They keep roughly 840{sheep,}10 or 11 {cows}and 32{hens}that lay eggs. They used to keep pigs. The busiest time of the year for Mr. Morgan is Autumn when they plough the fields and plant Winter corn. In Winter they look after the animals and do fencing. In Spring they concentrate on lambing, sowing and spraying. In Summer they make hay, silage and harvest the corn. Mr. Morgan goes to market twice a week to buy and sell sheep and cattle.
